After considering these details, I can conclude that the artist is likely to be someone prominent in the soul or R&B genre from that era.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who sings the song you'll never find another love like mine
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['At the pageant, Token performs the song "You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" by Lou Rawls. His singing voice was not provided by the usual dubbing actor Adrien Beard, but is in fact the original Lou Rawls recording of the song. The reason that Beard doesn\'t provide the singing is that Trey and Matt were dissatisfied with his singing in \n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love like Mine" (written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff) is a song performed by R&B singer Lou Rawls on his 1976 album "All Things in Time". The song proved to be Rawls\' breakthrough hit, reaching number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts as well as number four on the dance chart and number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, where it was kept from the top spot for two weeks by "You Should Be Dancing" by The Bee Gees and "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" by KC and the Sunshine Band, respectively. This was the first and only time that one of Rawls\' records managed to reach "Billboard"s pop top ten. It was the first big hit for Philadelphia International to feature the reformulated MFSB, after many of the original members left Gamble and Huff for better opportunities. The song started Rawls\' live shows from 1977 on.\n', '"You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by singers Michael Bublé, Laura Pausini, reggae singer John Holt and by the Dub Pistols (who use a sample of John Holt\'s version) on their "Speakers and Tweeters" album. Jazz saxophonist Stanley Turrentine covered the song on his 1976 album "The Man with the Sad Face". as did Hank Crawford on "Hank Crawford\'s Back". This song was also featured on "The Proud Family Soundtrack".\n', 'BULLET::::14. ""You\'ll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"" - Lou Rawls\n', "BULLET::::3. You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine - Lou Rawls*Written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff\n"]

This song is significant as it marked Rawls' breakthrough hit, achieving notable success on various music charts. Specifically, it reached number one on the R&B and Easy Listening charts, number four on the dance chart, and number two on the Billboard Hot 100. Its success was particularly noteworthy because it was the first time one of Rawls' records entered the pop top ten on Billboard.

The song was written by the renowned songwriting duo Kenny Gamble and Leon Huff, who were influential figures in the Philadelphia soul music scene. The song's arrangement and production were part of the reformulated MFSB (Mother Father Sister Brother) collective, which played a crucial role in the sound of Philadelphia International Records during that era.

In addition to Lou Rawls' original version, "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by various artists, including Michael Bublé and Laura Pausini, indicating its lasting appeal and influence across different musical genres. The song has also been featured in various media, such as "The Proud Family Soundtrack," which further demonstrates its cultural significance.

Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content. 
Fact-checking may involve the examination of data, literature, expert opinions, or other trustworthy sources.
In the context of artificial intelligence, model illusion refers to the overconfidence response of the AI.

question_info.question: who sings the song you'll never find another love like mine
passages:
At the pageant, Token performs the song "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" by Lou Rawls. His singing voice was not provided by the usual dubbing actor Adrien Beard, but is in fact the original Lou Rawls recording of the song. The reason that Beard doesn't provide the singing is that Trey and Matt were dissatisfied with his singing in 
"You'll Never Find Another Love like Mine" (written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff) is a song performed by R&B singer Lou Rawls on his 1976 album "All Things in Time". The song proved to be Rawls' breakthrough hit, reaching number one on both the R&B and Easy Listening charts as well as number four on the dance chart and number two on the US "Billboard" Hot 100, where it was kept from the top spot for two weeks by "You Should Be Dancing" by The Bee Gees and "(Shake, Shake, Shake) Shake Your Booty" by KC and the Sunshine Band, respectively. This was the first and only time that one of Rawls' records managed to reach "Billboard"s pop top ten. It was the first big hit for Philadelphia International to feature the reformulated MFSB, after many of the original members left Gamble and Huff for better opportunities. The song started Rawls' live shows from 1977 on.
"You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine" has been covered by singers Michael Bublé, Laura Pausini, reggae singer John Holt and by the Dub Pistols (who use a sample of John Holt's version) on their "Speakers and Tweeters" album. Jazz saxophonist Stanley Turrentine covered the song on his 1976 album "The Man with the Sad Face". as did Hank Crawford on "Hank Crawford's Back". This song was also featured on "The Proud Family Soundtrack".
BULLET::::14. ""You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine"" - Lou Rawls
BULLET::::3. You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine - Lou Rawls*Written by Kenny Gamble & Leon Huff
